meanings.definition: To educate or teach in a school setting.
meanings.sent1: The teacher skoled the students on math concepts.
meanings.sent2: Parents trust schools to skoled their children effectively.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to school the kittens on how to fetch.
meanings.sent4: Her experience as a nurse skoled her in the art of patience.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl skoled the young birds on the ways of the forest.

meanings.definition: To attend school or receive an education.
meanings.sent1: Children skoled every weekday to learn new things.
meanings.sent2: Students who skoled regularly tend to perform better academically.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to school itself by reading books.
meanings.sent4: Life skoled her in the importance of perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The adventurous explorer skoled himself in survival skills.

meanings.definition: A past tense form of the verb 'school'.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she shared stories of her skoled in a small village.
meanings.sent2: His skoled in a foreign land broadened his perspective.
meanings.sent3: The old photograph captured the joy of their skoled together.
meanings.sent4: The traveler's skoled across different cultures enriched his life.
meanings.sent5: The book detailed her skoled during challenging times.
